Executive Summary:
Latam team has been included on the Gong Pilot until the end of the year. It was necessary additional alignments within the provider to understand what capabilities we should expect to test since not all the functionalities will be available since we are not going to connect Gong with the local CRMs we have in the Region. ​

The decision was made to move forward with the pilot without having additional projects being required and test only the functionalities that are available in this model.
Key Risks and Issues:
During the first discussions of the pilot, we’ve identified that Gong cannot connect the same instance of the tool with difference SFDC instances. Since Latam users are on S2E SFDC instance or SGD as their CRMs, we needed to understand the capabilities / options to be considered under the pilot scope before moving forward. ​

We explored the different options for your Gong implementation, including setting up a new instance, using the existing GSI Salesforce instance, or waiting for another time. ​

We reviewed a comparison matrix of Gong features that would be available under each option, highlighting the limitations of the existing GSI instance in terms of account-based functionality. ​

We will need to have a local person trained by the Gong team due to language limitation, with that our launch will be postponed, since there is the need of a new SOW for the train the trainer program.

We will now translate the training material and schedule local session in Portuguese and Spanish.​

Gong integration with Genesys was confirmed. ​

Path Forward:

Translate training material​

Schedule internal training for users (Portuguese and Spanish)​

Integrate with Genesys and Teams​

Finalize “opt in” option to consent recording​

Finalizing Change Management communications and training

Overall Status: Amber
Executive Summary:
​The activities in November have primarily focused on the implementation and official launch of the Gong trial. ​

​

The pilot participants have access to the Gong platform and have been directed to the Gong Academy, a self-led training tool that helps end users utilize Gong effectively. Live training for Legal took place on November 6th. Gong SteerCo has finalized feedback metrics and method.  As part of Internal Change Management, Legal will utilize the Gong feedback loop as a prototype to gather feedback, benefits, and assessments for all future tech evaluations, which can then be applied to other tech evaluations and segments. Thus far, preliminary feedback reflects that Gong looks good for front leader productivity (reducing time spent on forecasting (~2 hrs per week) and that it provides greater forecasting accuracy. Also time savings around tasks such as meeting prep, meeting summarization is reducing tasks down to about 5 minutes as opposed to 15 to 20. We expect to see more and better data as the trial continues, and more feedback comes in.​

​

Copilot 365: 150 licenses were deployed on October 25th and now being utilized across the segment.​

Gainsight: Gainsight has been provisionally approved, and solution is due to be deployed  April 2025​

Key Risks and Issues:
Gong : Trial runs October-December and there is currently discussion around length of trial. Funding may also present some challenges in 2025 given current budget projections, so critical to determine ROI for purposes of a strong business case.​

​

Need strong change management cadence to drive adoption. Teams are adapting to a significant amount of change currently with new products, new vision for TR GAI, new selling skill (from product selling to value/ROI-based selling) and new CS model. Risk of introducing too much change at one time – mitigate with showing value to the rep/team member on how our internal adoption will support their new workflow and will streamline their efforts to drive efficiencies. The Gong change management strategy revolves around a 'leaders first' approach, cultivating a culture of innovation and adaptability and focus on developing powerful internal champions who drive transformation from within. by leveraging targeted use cases, for a clear and digestible way to apply Gong to their day to day workflow. ​

Overall Status: Green
Executive Summary: Next two Newsroom tools due to move into QA in December – Packaging and video shotlisting. 2025 planning well underway for Newsroom and client-facing Product streams. Newsroom 25 will also include moving some of our 24 work into BAU and working out what on-going measurement, refining etc needs to happen regularly. Also now working out how to integrate more AI into the functions beyond the newsroom including Sales, GCO.
Key Risks and Issues:
As we move some of our internal projects towards commercialisation, we need some different roles and structures. This is beyond the scope of the Internal AI Program but will be a large part of our shift in focus for 2025. There have been some delays on one of our client-focused projects due to ownership and planning processes which have shown us the need to start thinking differently in a fast test-and-iterate world.
eyond Newsroom, many of our commercial teams now need more help to integrate AI into their workflows and are finding limitations with the UI of Open Arena and limitations on which data we can use safely e.g. financial/HR/client data. We need to unlock some of these issues with the AI Platform and Responsible AI groups to understand where the limits are and how we can work within them.
Progress on Use Case this period:
Fact Genie has been expanded to include feeds from Italy, Poland, India, Australia and Singapore. Each has required quite a bit of extra work e.g. currency conversions, formatting etc. 
LEON usage seemed to drop which made no sense. The team worked out that changes to an ad blocker meant the data was not being captured of all the users so we are working to rectify that between Product and Editorial. 
AI-driven packaging tool now launched in lower environment for testing
Translation prompts are showing more than 75% reduction in errors vs DeepL. 
AI-assisted shotlisting delayed due to bugs in deployment of other tools but goes into testing w/c Dec 9. Positive client feedback about using synthetic voices in non-English packaged video (this is on the client side but requires some change management internally)
Details on Change Management:
We are now starting the change management on the Packaging team as we have merged two teams into one and are starting to prepare for the introduction of the new packaging tool. There is concern on the video desk that the new shotlisting tool may, in fact, add work without significant tuning so we may have to do more testing and iteration before rolling it out. This is a much anticipated time saver so we need to get it right for our colleagues as well as for our clients.  On AI-assisted non-English video, we need to explore exactly where the HITL sits and who does the QC from which team, rather than replicating old structures on the video team. 
Another 146 people trained on AI in LEON and Open Arena. 75 people attended AI for Visuals training. 55 did prompt workshops. 
We need more training and help integrating AI into the work of colleagues on our commercial teams and working out which are the best tools for them, where, at what cost and to what immediate benefit. 
As we expand the Reuters AI Strategy to build more tools for our clients, we will need new roles and structures but that will sit outside the scope of the Internal AI group.

Overall Status: Green
Executive Summary:
CoCounsel 2.0 and CoCounsel Drafting Implementation: The Services team has initiated conversations for implementing CoCounsel 2.0 and CoCounsel Drafting. A comprehensive project plan is expected by early Jan-2025, which will provide clarity on configuration steps, particularly regarding the integration of Contract Express (for Templates automation) and Practical Law (for Legal playbooks automation).

RFP Template Generation MVP: A Minimum Viable Product (MVP) for collaborative RFP Template generation has been successfully configured in Kronos, our Sourcing Projects Management solution. A formal User Acceptance Testing (UAT) is planned, involving Sourcing SMEs from the RFP Optimization program. This testing phase aims to validate capabilities and fine-tune the solution. The official go-live is scheduled for the second week of Jan-2025, with plans to automate additional RFP Templates in Q1.

Services Gateway Chatbot Development: After evaluating the 'TR Ask Julius' chatbot, the decision was made to develop the Services Gateway chatbot using Copilot Studio instead. This strategic choice leverages Copilot Studio's robust capabilities and Microsoft's ongoing investment in new features. The aim is to create a more advanced and adaptable chatbot solution that better aligns with long-term goals and evolving service needs.

Additionally, new use cases and efficiency metrics are being analyzed to align with 2025 financial planning, focusing on enhancing AI capabilities, improving efficiency, and ensuring seamless organization-wide adoption.
Key Risks and Issues:
•	Integration with Existing Systems: Integrating the AI solutions with existing systems, databases, and workflows may pose challenges.
•	Technical Challenges: Algorithm complexity could delay or impact the effectiveness of the solution. We will mitigate this risk by adoption CoCounsel.
•	User Adoption and Change Management: Introducing a new AI-driven process requires user training and change management efforts to ensure adoption. Resistance to change or difficulties in understanding and using the new solution could hinder project success.
•	Legal Recommendation: Contract Analysis data protection is mandatory and LLMs can’t ensure this. Co-Counsel is an internal TR tool that could offer the same capabilities ensuring data protection and confidentiality.
Progress on Use Case this period:
CoCounsel for Contract Drafting:
•	CoCounsel Core Prompts library was successfully deployed on 08/13. This all-encompassing resource hub was designed to support the seamless internal adoption of CoCounsel, offering a wealth of tools and information, including:
o	Prompts Library for Tested Scenarios: Explore a carefully selected collection of prompts specifically tested for procurement scenarios, ensuring you can leverage CoCounsel effectively in real-world applications.
o	Product Training Resources: Access detailed guides and tutorials to get the most out of CoCounsel's powerful features.
o	Guidance and Support Links: Find relevant links for expert guidance and support to navigate any challenges you may encounter.
o	Success Stories and More: Gain insights from success stories and best practices shared by Sourcing and Contract Managers who have successfully integrated CoCounsel into their workflows.
•	CoCounsel Utilization Report: Starting September, we implemented a robust procedure to monitor and analyze the usability and adoption of CoCounsel based on a usage report shared by the TR Product team. This initial report (September) outlined the initial 8 weeks of CoCounsel Core adoption within the Services team. This report captured data from July 8th (UAT launch) to August 30th, reflecting the number of team members who accessed the solution and executed at least one query. Please note: 
o	This report focuses exclusively on CoCounsel Core V1. Usage reports for V2 and Drafting will be incorporated as they become available and as we progress with implementation activities.
o	This analysis will serve as a foundation for our ongoing monitoring and evaluation of CoCounsel Core's adoption and utilization within our organization.
o	Adoption report for Sep-Nov period is under development, updated adoption rates with be distributed the week of Dec 9th,

Key Findings
o	Adoption Rate: 40% of Services team engaged (40 out of 99 members).  Employee Breakdown: 35 Procurement, 5 Real Estate.

How are Services people using CoCounsel?
o	About 1000 non-Skill messages: Interactions that are not directly related to the CoCounsel core skills (General queries, user feedback, system messages, etc.).
o	About 500 Skill runs: Interactions are directly related to the CoCounsel core skills (Summarize, Review, Contract Terms extraction, Policy Compliance, etc.).
o	150+ Summarize (32%)
o	150+ Contract Data extraction (32%)
o	 90+ Review Documents (20%)
o	 40 Document comparison / Policy Compliance (7%)
o	 40 Draft Correspondence (7%)

•	Surveys:   The Pull Request (PR) driven survey responses are steady at 20%.  Have already communicated to Engineering Pilot participants to help drive higher participation.  Need to further socialize with Champions and PE LT for tops down push to help drive greater response rates and implement possible mandatory training. 
•	Data Accuracy:   GitHub's seat and usage telemetry APIs are stable over last four months.  
•	Tool Evaluation: Continued evaluation of the impact and value of various tools, including GitHub Copilot, to ensure they are continuing to add value to the organization and business.
Progress on Use Case this period:
Adoption:  GitHub CoPilot licenses increased by 150  and we now have 3183  licensed users  across Thomson Reuters.  We added executive summary to the dashboard Github Copilot dashboard  and license activations continue to be tracked, continuing in monitor and maintain mode.  
Usage & Engagement: Upon request, Github recently shared a benchmarking report of Copilot usage based on their internal datasets.  The report does show TR usage trending above industry averages by 10+ percentage points across all three of % active user, % engaged user and %  installed/authenticated user.  In particular, Github’s report shows TR’s weekly engaged rates remaining steady at around.  
Measuring Impact: Based on the pull request analysis, results show increased productivity post-Copilot, with a 20-30% increase in the average number of PRs created and merged. About 80% of the champions took the survey and provided positive feedback on its use, noting notable challenges and limitations with lengthy code generation, legacy scripts, etc., which are known and documented. 

AWS Q Developer:   While GitHub Copilot remains the superior overall tool, AWS Q Developer is particularly effective for working with AWS technologies and has shown significant improvement. We are beginning to roll out AWS Q across the organization, following a similar approach to GitHub Copilot adoption. This will allow for a comprehensive comparison of AI Pair Programming tools and leverage existing metrics dashboards.
Details on Change Management: Continue monitor and maintain mode.
Path Forward:
Measure and validate tool impact:  Continued analysis of PR events data to understand and validate impact of AI tools adoption on developer productivity.  Provide breakdown of Usage metrics at team level.
Enable Amazon Q Developer:  Work with Platform Engineering to add Q Developer to our developer tool stack as a second option for AI-augmented development tool.
Improve license and PR survey awareness: Increase awareness among teams about their existing GitHub Copilot licenses to ensure full utilization and PR surveys so we can continually learn and improve from their feedback shared.

Overall Status: Green
Executive Summary:
Given the complex and specialized nature of our customer interactions, CXDT continues to concentrate on a range of small AI initiatives to facilitate self-service, expedite agent responses, and improve productivity through AI-generated summaries and suggested actions. These efforts are intended to achieve cost savings in 2025.  Key updates since the last report include: 
•	The Intelligent Assistant now supports UltraTax, Accounting, and Practice CS, with agent training progressing on schedule for the Spring Peak period.
•	Salesforce Einstein GPT and knowledge workflow AI features saw a 17% increase in interactions from September to October, with a notable 72% rise in GPT Chat wrap-up summarizations.
•	A proof of concept for a Gen AI solution is being tested to update Help and Support content, focusing on improving the model and developing a user-friendly interface.
•	The ONSOURCE Product Support Assistant, launched on October 24th, uses AI to address customer questions within the product with the goal of reducing support contacts.  Impact analysis pending.
•	In November, the call deflection for the WhatsApp-based AI self-service tool increased by 16% to 30.1%, with 63% of requests solved without human interaction, and a 37% decrease in early abandoned contacts showing positive customer engagement trends.
•	A revised view of 2025 savings pathways has been completed to serve as a baseline for ongoing measurement and reporting.
Key Risks and Issues:
1.	RISK - The rollout of Salesforce Einstein has slowed due to problems with publishing from AEM Guides to Salesforce and content creation capacity constraints.  An Adobe hotfix introduced new issues, requiring another fix now slated to be deployed in February 2025. This delay adds risk to the planned 2025 efficiencies.
a.	Mitigation Strategy: Agents are undergoing training, and generative AI is being explored to address capacity constraints. Discussions are underway to implement Einstein AI features that do not rely on knowledge content, in advance of resolving knowledge content issues.
2.	RISK - Efficiencies estimates: Multiple risks to the accuracy of the 2025 productivity estimates including overlap - where anticipated productivity gains from multiple AI initiatives may overlap, delivery timing, incorrect assumptions, etc.  impacting our overall savings estimates. 
•	Mitigation Strategy: A monthly review will be implemented in 2025 to measure impact and update estimates. Lessons learned will be communicated back to the group to enhance estimate accuracy. New initiatives may be introduced to address any identified savings gaps.
Progress on Use Case this period:
•	The ONSOURCE Product Support Assistant launched to customers on October 24th using Help & Support content. This product assistant, developed by the ONESOURCE team, employs AI to answer customer questions within the product, aiming to reduce customer support contacts.  Teams are working to analyze any impact to customer service.
•	The Intelligent Assistant now serves UltraTax, Accounting, and Practice CS. Tool enhancements and agent training are on schedule for Spring Peak. Accounting and Practice CS pilot is 72% through training, targeting 81 employees. UltraTax aims to train 209 agents, with 38 already trained, and includes a feedback loop for improvements. The tech team has automated content updates with AEM exporter and is ensuring adequate user capacity and monitoring.  
•	Salesforce Einstein GPT and knowledge workflow AI features observed a 17% increase in interactions from September to October with the same user base.   The largest adoption increase was in the GPT Chat wrap-up summarization features which saw a 72% increase m/m. Roll-out to additional groups has paused as teams address technical challenges syncing help content into Salesforce and creating new support content. One major blocker is pending a hotfix from Adobe slated for the February 2025 release.
•	In November, the call deflection for the WhatsApp-based AI self-service tool was 30.1%, an increase of 16% Month over month, and 63% of requests were solved without human interaction. Early abandoned contact was 15%, a decrease of 37% Month over Month showing a positive trend in customer engagement. The in-product Product Support Assistant launched for corporate customers of the TaxOne product on November 21 with 10% initial engagement and very positive feedback.
•	A POC of Gen AI solution to update Help and Support content.  The AI assistant performs two functions 1.  It retrieves related articles and 2.  It uses retrieved articles to update existing articles or generate new articles.  This two-step approach enables the assistant to address multiple use cases for the content strategy and design team.   The team is currently testing to identify areas for improvement in the model and creating a simple UI to make it easier to work with the assistant. 
•	Completed a revised view of 2025 savings pathways to be used as a baseline for ongoing measurement and reporting.
Details on Change Management:
AI adoption across CXDT remains high with 61% adoption in October, up 2 pp from September.  Progress against other CXDT AI-related OKRs is also strong with 59% employees having attended 2 AI learning events through October against a target of 100%. With the end of Fall busy season, additional emphasis has been placed on completing these 2 AI learning events by year end.  12 AI experiences have been launched through September 2024 exceeding the full-year target of 8 launches by 50%.

In response to job security concerns related to AI, identified through feedback from the AI Skills and Adoption survey, Earvin Feliciano conducted an AI Manager support session. This session aimed to equip managers with the necessary tools and knowledge to integrate AI into their teams' workflows effectively. The presentation included findings from the AI Awareness & Skills Survey, which highlighted high levels of AI awareness and positive attitudes towards AI adoption among people managers. During the session, Earvin emphasized the importance of fostering a growth mindset and creating a psychologically safe environment for teams. Practical guidance was provided on how to communicate the benefits of AI to team members and address their concerns transparently. Additionally, the session introduced the People Leader AI Implementation Toolkit, designed to assist managers in incorporating Generative AI tools into daily operations. The event concluded with a Q&A segment to address specific questions and issues.

The team is also exploring leveraging the AIvolution tool (Ideaspace Hub) as a way to capture and govern AI innovation ideas.
Path Forward:
Continued Development and Deployment of planned AI Initiatives
•	Ultra Tax Intelligent Assistant expansion to Accounting and Practice CS and agent training in preparation for Spring peak. December
•	Continued roll-out of Salesforce Einstein capabilities across CSS groups including Legal CTS, CS UK, Case Center, Document Intelligence, GTM LatAm.  Q1 2025
Operationalize Efficiency Savings Measurement:
•	Socialize the detailed view of 2025 savings pathways with CSS leaders. December
•	Operationalize cadence to measure against projected productivity savings and build into headcount plans.  December
•	Analyze and improve productivity savings projections by comparing projections and actuals.  Ongoing
Communication/Governance:
•	Highlight success stories and measurable impacts across CXDT through multiple channels (team meetings, town halls, email comms, etc.)  to inspire continued innovation and AI adoption. Ongoing
•	Implement AIvolution tool (IdeaSpace Hub) to capture and prioritize AI innovation ideas. Q1 2025

Some initial indicators of efficiency gains in Market & Competitive Intelligence research.
Key Risks and Issues:
1.	Risk: Use cases not usable due to strictly confidential requirements in M&A. 
Mitigation: align with product roadmap for HighQ with CoCounsel. Review security and capability with Product team. Ensure 'Strictly Confidential' profile is enabled when using Open Arena
2.	Risks: Leadership use of CoPilot is still experimental, but not showing significant value in drafting improvement yet. 
Mitigation: obtain formal feedback on pros and cons of user experience, as well as set up  session with Strategy team  on effective prompts.
Progress on Use Case this period:
•	The strategy team has been experimenting with CoPilot during October / November, with ~42 users recorded.  The biggest benefit called out has been in CoPilot recaps / summaries of meetings, particularly noted for use in Venture meetings / discussions.
•	An internal campaign initiated with the MCI team to drive the engagement to test and submit additional use cases. 
o	Continue to monitor progress of Corporate Product Roadmap for the use of CoCounsel in HighQ. 
o	IMO demonstration to Strategy Corp Dev team of their Open Arena use case, was useful with guidance on how to activate 'Strictly Confidential' Profiles
•	~935 queries have been made on Open Arena in January (across our team of 46 users). 50% of these requests are made by our Market & Competitive Intelligence team (representing 20% of our team) in support of business research requests and the production of competitive updates.
Details on Change Management: We are reinforcing ongoing use of AI tools, and initiated a campaign for further submission or evolution of use cases. With planning and leadership workshops / conference in January momentum slowed a bit, but we will pick it up in February. Corp Development, MCI and the Ventures teams remain the likely sub-groups in Strategy that would benefit the most in potential efficiencies (subject to security around Strictly Confidential information).
Path Forward:
Obtain input from Product team on roadmap and capability of HighQ with CoCounsel, and evaluate business value and productivity implications for the Corp Dev function within the strategy team.
Quantifying the benefits of time saved / quality output continues to be a challenge and will be the focus for Q1.

Our Editorial organization is executing a comprehensive AI transformation strategy, combining immediate operational gains with strategic positioning for future growth.

•	Advancing development of AI-powered tools for Practical Law drafting, including Legal Updates and Trackers.
•	Established a robust foundation for accelerated AI implementation in 2025.

Strategic Framework:
Our AI initiatives focus on efficiency gains and simplification to enable our four core strategic priorities:
•	Increased Content Currency
•	Enhanced Value Addition to Content
•	AI-Ready Content
•	Coverage Expansion
Primary Focus Areas:
•	Authored Content Updating: Four funded AI builds in development for 2025, positioning us for resource optimization advances.
•	Editorial Assistant Automation: Two funded AI builds in development for 2025; streamlines time-intensive, repetitive tasks; enhances consistency and quality; frees specialized resources for high-value activities.
•	Editorial Expertise: Leverages our unique intellectual capital; positions us as leaders in Legal and Tax AI innovation; supports broader AI transformation strategy.
•	Self-Service AI Solutions: Drives efficiency through "Fast Track" implementation; empowers editorial teams with AI-enhanced capabilities; improves precision and quality.
Current Momentum:
Our December 2024 launch demonstrates our ability to execute complex AI initiatives at scale. The successful deployment has created organizational momentum and valuable insights that will accelerate our 2025 roadmap delivery. This comprehensive approach ensures we are not just adopting AI but strategically integrating it to revolutionize our editorial capabilities.

Overall Status: Green
Executive Summary:
In 2025 The CXDT AI portfolio of initiatives continues to center on 3 main pillars:
1.  Customer Self Service - a suite of initiatives to incorporate AI into our customers self-help experience with the goal of getting them the answers they need quickly and accurately without the need to contact an agent
2.  Agent Knowledge & Productivity - a suite of initiatives to enhance agent productivity through AI by handling routine tasks, providing personalized knowledge recommendations and answers, with the goal to improve customer service outcomes and overall productivity
3.  Other Operational Support - a suite of initiatives leveraging AI to support productivity improvements across other groups within CXDT.  There are multiple initiatives under each pillar and in total will achieve the cost savings target set for CXDT in 2025.  
Key updates since the last report include: 
•	Intelligent Assistant : UltraTax, Accounting, and Practice CS now utilize the Intelligent Assistant. Agent training is complete. The tech team has automated content updates and ensured adequate user capacity and monitoring.  Spring peak is underway and impact metrics will be reported next month.
•	Salesforce Einstein GPT: December observed a dip in usage due to reduced contact volume over the holidays. Roll-out to additional groups is paused due to technical challenges. A major blocker is an Adobe hotfix expected by February 10, 2025.
•	LatAm Self-Service: The number of customers requesting support from the AI solution embedded in the TaxOne product increased by 90% MoM in December,  The Product Support Assistant for LegalOne launched on January 29, with feedback expected next month.
•	Help and Support Content Team: The team is analyzing new AI tools from Adobe and will decide by mid-February whether to continue their proof of concept or adopt vendor functionality. The current POC performs article retrieval and content updates/generation.
•	Genesys Salesforce Voice: Funding has been received for implementation, integrating telephony into Salesforce for a unified customer interaction platform. AI features will enhance agent productivity. Deployment to 225 agents is planned for Q1 after configuration and training.
•	An initial pathway to  2025 savings target has been identified and confirmed with leadership.   A monthly review and quarterly updated cadence have been implemented.
Key Risks and Issues:
"1.	RISK - The rollout of Salesforce Einstein has slowed due to problems with publishing from AEM Guides to Salesforce and content creation capacity constraints.  An Adobe hotfix will deployed in February 202 (2/10/25) and content will push to Salesforce soon after. This delay adds risk to the planned 2025 efficiencies.
a.	Mitigation Strategy: Agents have undergone training to author help and support content and generative AI available through Adobe are being explored to address capacity constraints. 
2.	RISK - Efficiencies estimates: Multiple risks to the accuracy of the 2025 productivity estimates including overlap - where anticipated productivity gains from multiple AI initiatives may overlap, delivery timing, incorrect assumptions, etc.  impacting our overall savings estimates. 
•	Mitigation Strategy: A monthly review will be implemented in 2025 to measure impact and update estimates. Lessons learned will be communicated back to the group to enhance estimate accuracy. New initiatives will be introduced to address any identified savings gaps.
Progress on Use Case this period:
"•	The Intelligent Assistant now serves UltraTax, Accounting, and Practice CS. Tool enhancements and agent training are on schedule for Spring Peak. Accounting and Practice CS pilot is 72% through training, targeting 81 employees. UltraTax aims to train 209 agents, with 38 already trained, and includes a feedback loop for improvements. The tech team has automated content updates with AEM exporter and is ensuring adequate user capacity and monitoring.  
•	Salesforce Einstein GPT and knowledge workflow AI features observed a dip in December as expected with reduced contact volume and more out of office time due to the holidays. Roll-out to additional groups has paused as teams address technical challenges syncing help content into Salesforce and creating new support content. One major blocker is pending a hotfix from Adobe with February 10, 2025 release.
•	In December, December, call deflection reached 26.3%, showing a slight decrease MoM, primarily due to lower demand at the year's end.  In contrast, the number of customers requesting support from the AI solution embedded in the TaxOne product increased by 90% MoM. Finally, with the go-live of the AI self-support solution to the TAP Chile operation, we conclude the rollout for al Latam customers. The in-product Product Support Assistant launched for corporate customers of the LegalOne product on January 29.  Customer feedback and impact will be reported next month.  
•	The  Help and Support content team has paused at the proof of concept stage for a home-grown Gen AI solution while analyzing AI tools becoming available through their vendor Adobe.  Team aims to decide by mid-February whether to continue to pursue POC functionality or pivot to adopting vendor functionality.  The POC of Gen AI for  Help and Support content performs two functions 1.  It retrieves related articles and 2.  It uses retrieved articles to update existing articles or generate new articles.  This two-step approach enables the assistant to address multiple use cases for the content strategy and design team.   
•	We have received funding to implement Genesys Salesforce Voice.  This feature integrates telephony into Salesforce, providing a unified platform for all customer interactions. The AI features include real-time call transcription and AI-powered insights from Salesforce Einstein, which enhance agent productivity by offering next best actions and reducing manual data entry. We plan to deploy the new system to 225 agents, including 157 customer service representatives and 68 reference attorneys, in Q1 after completing the necessary configuration and training.
Details on Change Management:
"An initial pathway to  2025 savings target has been identified and confirmed with leadership.  We are on track against our 2025 savings target through January 2025.   A monthly review and quarterly update cadence have been implemented to ensure the forecast and savings actuals can be kept current in 2025.  This process was shared with Internal AI Business Leads and Global Centers leadership in late January as info as other groups are designing their processes.

CXDT ended 2024 with excellent progress against  AI-related OKRs:
1.  59% of employees adopted AI tools against a goal of exceeding the full-year target of 33% adoption by 78%.
2.  79% of CXDT employees  attended 2 AI learning events in 2025 against a target of 100%. 
3.  15 AI experiences were launched across CXDT exceeding the full-year target of 8 launches by 88%.
CXDT has adopted the TR Enterprise AI OKR for 2025 and will ensure 50% of CXDT employees are using Gen AI tools regularly as part of their daily task.  

In support of the 2025 goal and to address feedback from 2024 the AI Skills and Adoption survey CXDT AI lead and HRBP are working through a department AI communications plan including AI Champions and persona-based AI learning recommendations for 2025.

The team will also begin an initiative to leveraging the AIvolution tool (Ideaspace Hub) as a way to capture and govern AI innovation ideas in February.

In Q1 CXDT  expanded our suite of 365 Copilot licenses from ~100 to ~180. Expansion of license availability is largely targeted at product/project managers and team leads/people managers to as initial trial of licenses with those teams indicated an opportunity for efficiency gain as these roles work largely within MSFT suite of tools.
Path Forward:
"Continued Development and Deployment of planned AI Initiatives
•	Intelligent Assistant: Monitor impact through Spring Peak for UltraTax, Accounting, and Practice CS teams.
•	Salesforce Einstein GPT: Address technical challenges with help content syncing and create new support content. Awaiting hotfix from Adobe, scheduled for February 10, 2025.
•	WhatsApp-based AI Tool: Report customer feedback and impact of the LegalOne product launch. Monitor call deflection and early abandoned contact rates.
•	Help and Support Content Team: Decide by mid-February on pursuing proof of concept functionality versus vendor functionality from Adobe. The proof of concept involves retrieving and updating articles using Gen AI.
•	Genesys Salesforce Voice: Implement and deploy to 225 agents in Q1, including customer service representatives and reference attorneys. Focus on configuration and training.
Communication/Governance:
•	Highlight success stories and measurable impacts across CXDT through multiple channels (team meetings, town halls, email comms, etc.)  to inspire continued innovation and AI adoption. Ongoing
•	Implement AIvolution tool (IdeaSpace Hub) to capture and prioritize AI innovation ideas. Q1 2025
•	Analyze and improve productivity savings projections by comparing projections and actuals.  Ongoing

Overall Status: Amber
Executive Summary:
The activities in November have primarily focused on the implementation and official launch of the Gong trial. ​

The pilot participants have access to the Gong platform and have been directed to the Gong Academy, a self-led training tool that helps end users utilize Gong effectively. Live training for Legal took place on November 6th. Gong SteerCo has finalized feedback metrics and method.  As part of Internal Change Management, Legal will utilize the Gong feedback loop as a prototype to gather feedback, benefits, and assessments for all future tech evaluations, which can then be applied to other tech evaluations and segments. Thus far, preliminary feedback reflects that Gong looks good for front leader productivity (reducing time spent on forecasting (~2 hrs per week) and that it provides greater forecasting accuracy. Also time savings around tasks such as meeting prep, meeting summarization is reducing tasks down to about 5 minutes as opposed to 15 to 20. We expect to see more and better data as the trial continues, and more feedback comes in.​

​

Copilot 365: 150 licenses were deployed on October 25th and now being utilized across the segment.​

​

Gainsight: Gainsight has been provisionally approved, and solution is due to be deployed  April 2025​
Key Risks and Issues:
Gong : Trial ran October-December, with Gong trial licenses still in play. 

Legal has now acquired Gong licenses. Devon Whiteford is working with Eric Kim and other key stakeholders to establish a Change Management plan to ensure swift and effective adoption of Gong once launched. 

​

Gainsight incorporated in Customer Success business case.  ​

​
Progress on Use Case this period:
Gong: Establishing a feedback model has ensured consistent feedback from all Legal segments - this feedback system will be implemented in all future trials as part of Legal's “TR Way” approach to new AI technology.​

​
Feedback from both Leadership and End Users has been positive. End Users have reported time-saving benefits against tasks including meeting prep, email composure and summaries. They estimate they save between 15-30 minutes per task, with significant savings over the course of a week. Leadership also report similar savings, but have also noted that Gong enables them to save approx 2-4 hours per week on forecasting. The also see the benefits of the coaching tools and expect them to support and enhance performance within their teams. Client AI has also been noted as valuable, although it doesn't always deliver the desired insight, however this is likely to be the result of "messy" data in Salesforce.
Details on Change Management:
Lindsey Hefty and Heather Kirsebom have been collaborating with CE on creating a "TR Way" to evaluate technology, and we recognize the need for improvements in piloting and implementing new sales tech, such as Gong. The intention is to leverage the Gong pilot as a prototype for gathering feedback across segments or products and focus on developing a process for Business Transformation leads to have a proper feedback loop. The team also intends to work with CE to better deploy pilots, tech rollouts, and proper champions to generate faster adoption rates of tech within their segments.  ​

Planned initiatives include:​

Technology Agnostic Feedback Assessment:  We will utilize the Gong feedback loop as a prototype to gather feedback, benefits, and assessments for all future tech evaluations, which can then be applied to other tech evaluations and segments.​

Collaboration with Business Transformation Leads: Identify a Steer Co to work with leads in each segment who can collaborate with the Business Transformation leads to gather channel feedback on Sales Tech, Identify Champions, and pinpoint gaps in processes and enablement.​

Quarterly Stakeholder Meetings with Segment/CE: Once Steer Co has been established with the Business Transformation lead, we will establish a quarterly stakeholder meeting to provide feedback to CE on sales tech and reevaluate the champions program and responsibilities ​

​

AI initiatives that have been rolled out by other enterprises that are currently under consideration to be utilized for Legal are:​

Eye on AI – Teams channel dedicated to AI updates, tips etc. Keeping Legal informed and encouraging engagement​

3 Ways to Use AI Today – Focus on 3 key AI tools supporting sales – briefly highlight capabilities and benefits – encourage engagement supporting 2025 OKRs​

Quarterly AI Email Comms - Status update re Copilot, Open Arena workshops, Call AI, Gong pilot and other relevant tech. Highlight benefits, AI success stories etc
Path Forward:
Copilot 365 Licenses: Licenses have been deployed to end users and comms have been sent.​

Gainsight: Business Case relating to Gainsight spend has been approved solution due to be deployed ~April 2025.​

Gong: Licenses acquired - to be assigned and deployed

Executive Summary:
CoCounsel 2.0 and CoCounsel Drafting Implementation: An implementation strategy has been developed, with CoCounsel V2 scheduled for deployment by end of Q1-2025 and CoCounsel Drafting by end of Q2-2025. The implementation plan will undergo final review and validation with Spencer Caldwell on February 4. Initial implementation activities for CoCounsel V2, beginning with training programs, are set to commence in the third week of February. The strategy for CC Drafting includes potential integrations with Contract Express for Templates automation and Practical Law for Legal playbooks automation.

RFP Template Generation MVP: The Minimum Viable Product (MVP) for collaborative RFP Template generation has been successfully configured in Kronos, our Sourcing Projects Management solution. User Acceptance Testing (UAT) is scheduled for the third week of February, engaging Sourcing SMEs from the RFP Optimization program to validate functionality and optimize the solution. The formal go-live has been set for the second week of March 2025, followed by plans to expand RFP Template automation throughout Q2.

Services Gateway Chatbot Development: Following evaluation of the 'TR Ask Julius' chatbot, development will proceed using Copilot Studio to leverage its advanced capabilities and Microsoft's continuous feature enhancements. This strategic decision aims to create a more sophisticated and flexible chatbot solution that aligns with our long-term objectives. The initial MVP, focusing on the Travel & Expenses process, is scheduled for implementation by the second week of March, establishing a foundation for future expansion and enhancement of service delivery.
Key Risks and Issues:
-Integration with Existing Systems: Integrating the AI solutions with existing systems, databases, and workflows may pose challenges.
-Technical Challenges: Algorithm complexity could delay or impact the effectiveness of the solution. We will mitigate this risk by adoption CoCounsel.
-User Adoption and Change Management: Introducing a new AI-driven process requires user training and change management efforts to ensure adoption. Resistance to change or difficulties in understanding and using the new solution could hinder project success.
-Legal Recommendation: Contract Analysis data protection is mandatory and LLMs can’t ensure this. Co-Counsel is an internal TR tool that could offer the same capabilities ensuring data protection and confidentiality.

Overall Status: Amber
Executive Summary:
As we move into 2025, our corporate AI strategy remains focused on leveraging internal and third-party tools to drive productivity gains, operational efficiencies, and enhanced customer satisfaction, ultimately improving Net Revenue Retention. Our key objectives are to maximize the potential of our existing tools, particularly Salesforce and Gainsight, and identify areas where additional solutions can further support our goals.

Current Progress and Initiatives:
We are optimizing the use of tools like MS Copilot, with expanded access across the organization, to enhance productivity and efficiency.
Our Professional Services team is actively working on two projects aimed at driving productivity gains, with an additional nine projects in the scoping phase for future development.

Pilot Program Update:
A pilot of Gong was conducted in Q4-2024, with 20 out of 40 participants actively engaging. Although feedback was positive, we have decided not to proceed with a full rollout due to funding and resource constraints.

Future Direction:
Our strategy for 2025 is to continue to fully utilize our current tools and assess potential gaps that may be addressed through additional solutions.
We will prioritize initiatives that drive tangible productivity gains, operational efficiencies, and customer satisfaction improvements, ultimately supporting our Net Revenue Retention goals.

By building on our existing foundation and strategically investing in AI-powered tools and initiatives, we are well-positioned to drive business growth, improve customer satisfaction, and maintain our competitive edge in the market.
Key Risks and Issues:
The successful execution of our Corporate Internal Gen AI strategy is contingent upon addressing several key risks and issues. The following areas require attention to ensure the effective implementation and adoption of our AI-powered tools:

Resourcing Constraints: The strategy's success is dependent on securing additional resourcing to drive the development and deployment of AI-powered solutions. Insufficient resourcing may hinder our ability to fully leverage the potential of our existing tools, such as Gainsight, Salesforce, and Conversica, and may limit our capacity to explore new solutions.

Centralized Team Support: It was already called out and acknowledged in a February 4 meeting that more support is needed from centralized teams and product owners. To ensure end-users are aware of and proficient in using the Gen AI functionality, we require more active engagement and enablement from these teams. This includes providing training, documentation, and change management support to facilitate seamless adoption and optimal utilization of our AI-powered tools.

End-User Adoption and Enablement: The effective use of Gainsight, Salesforce, and Conversica, in particular, relies on end-users being aware of the Gen AI functionality and understanding how to leverage it to drive productivity gains and customer satisfaction improvements. Without sufficient support and enablement, we risk underutilization of these critical tools, which may negatively impact our ability to achieve our Net Revenue Retention goals.

To mitigate these risks, it is essential that we prioritize securing additional resourcing, foster stronger collaboration with centralized teams and product owners, and develop a comprehensive enablement strategy to support end-user adoption and proficiency with our AI-powered tools. By addressing these key risks and issues, we can ensure the successful execution of our Corporate Internal Gen AI strategy and realize the full potential of our AI-powered tools to drive business growth and customer satisfaction.
Progress on Use Case this period:
Professional Services Team Initiatives: The Professional Services team has made significant headway on two high-priority use cases, which are currently in development. Additionally, nine further use cases are being refined and will be presented to the Analytics team for support in scoping and implementing. This collaboration will enable us to leverage data-driven insights to inform our AI-powered solutions and drive business outcomes.

MS Copilot Expansion: We have successfully secured an additional 105 MS Copilot licenses, effective January 1, 2025. This expansion will enable more employees to leverage the productivity-enhancing capabilities of MS Copilot, driving efficiency gains and supporting our goal of improving Net Revenue Retention through enhanced customer satisfaction and reduced churn.
Details on Change Management:
Training and Enablement:
Introduction to Open Arena training was provided on 6/12/2024
Sales Enablement offered virtual, instructor-led workshops on Open Arena and Copilot on Bing, which started in August 2024 and have attracted 327 attendees as of September 24.
Copilot for 365 training was held 9/12/2024

Communication and Awareness:
The Corporates Eye on AI Launch included the creation of a Teams channel on 8/15/2024 and a champions network on 8/20/2024.
A newsletter was initially planned but was put on pause due to competing Future of Corporates (FoC) priorities.

Feedback and Pulse Checks:
The September OHI survey included a question on AI adoption, with 76% of participants responding that they agree the organization helps them understand and use AI in their daily work.

End-of-Year Update:
Communications were paused in light of Future of Corporates priorities.
Path Forward:
As we look to 2025, our path forward is focused on building on the foundation established in 2024, with a emphasis on optimizing the adoption of our current tools, expanding the use of AI-powered solutions, and driving business outcomes through targeted use cases. Key priorities include:

Optimizing Current Tools: We will focus on maximizing the potential of our existing tools, particularly Gainsight and Salesforce, to drive productivity gains, operational efficiencies, and customer satisfaction improvements.

Restarting and Expanding Conversica: We will restart and expand our use of Conversica, leveraging its capabilities to enhance our sales and customer engagement efforts.

Accelerating Professional Services Use Cases: We will prioritize the development of Professional Services use cases, focusing on internal process improvement initiatives that drive tangible business outcomes. The recent Professional Services focus group meeting on November 20 marked an important step in this effort, and we will continue to build on this momentum.

Guidance from Corporate Leadership: We will seek guidance from Corporate leadership on the support and resources that will be provided to drive our Corporate Internal Gen AI strategy in 2025. This will ensure that our efforts are aligned with organizational priorities and that we have the necessary backing to achieve our objectives.

Overall Status: Green
Executive Summary: We are moving some of our 2024 projects into scale-up and adding some new ideas into the Newsroom AI workstreams. We have also named a new small team to look at AI efficiencies and use cases outside the newsroom. As we consider the best use cases, we will change the focus of Reuters Internal AI initiatives as we believe this is also the best way to get more learnings from similar functions across the rest of TR.
Key Risks and Issues: AI development is moving incredibly quickly - faster than we can change, adapt and adopt AI in the newsroom given some of our processes. There is a risk that we remain too focused on solving past problems rather than give due weight to the opportunities that lie ahead. We are considering carving out a percentage of time for key team members to do more AI research e.g. on small language models built in similar ways to Deep Seek. Another risk is that solutions we created in the past, particularly Avista, might no longer be fit for purpose as models have moved on so quickly. We need to be nimble (think fast, act fast!) and persuade teams it is fine to pivot but without making them dizzy.
Progress on Use Case this period:
Fact Genie continues to roll out across more markets (Malaysia, New Zealand in testing). 133 users across January. More alerts are being edited than before so we are checking for model drift. Also trying to improve the relevance of alerts being suggested to improve signal/noise ratio but without losing signal - GREEN
Some of the LEON tools have switched over to Claude from GPT 4o so we have added a new disclaimer in the UI to comply with the terms of agreement TR has with Anthropic. New tools to be added in February and will report on them/adoption next month. [need adoption numbers from BI] - GREEN
Packaging tool launch delayed until end-Feb and some key paperwork is still pending - AMBER
AVISTA in VESPA is now in GA but only released to a small number of testers as there are some serious issues with performance in terms of formatting and latency. Moving this back to RED
Translation - we are setting up some testing datasets to evaluate more potential solutions. Currently working on integrating the French language AI editor. Also, not efficiency but FYI, we are going to start translating and voicing packaged video using AI to serve clients in Latin America better in March. This is net new content for our clients.
Details on Change Management: We are polling all Reuters staff on the AI tools, training and communications we provided in 2024 so that we can better shape things for 2025. Our W/AI Forward email series has a decent open rate but we need more people to engage. There will be regular AI slots in both the Editorial and Reuters town halls to keep pushing out messaging and getting people used to using AI. We are also living up to the promise that people whose jobs might be impacted by AI will likely see their roles expand (Spanish and Portuguese video launch and new roles on Project LUX). We had excellent engagement on AI at the ASM and are working with Ethelda Makoid to get some more sales training across from TR into Reuters and expect this will help people on their own journey in gen AI.
Path Forward:
Fact Genie - expanding out the scope beyond corporate press releases in 2025 to look at all sources that come into our breaking news hubs. This fits with a Product plan to fold our five alerting tools into one, AI-enhanced tool 
LEON - we are moving beyond summarisation and headlines to include our first editing tools, live transcription and French translation editing in the next months. More broadly we are running a POC to see how gen AI can help us draft stories. 
AVISTA - we may need a rethink of our video workflow tools given issues with latency in the current solution. We will link this work to the new customer-focused Agency AI stream as many of the issues we have in video production are similar for our clients. It's a good opportunity to stop and rethink.
Open Arena - still developing a lot of tools there which we may bring across to LEON. The back-end work to lift and shift is now done.

Overall Status: Green - As per plan or better
Executive Summary:
As we move into 2025, our corporate AI strategy remains focused on leveraging internal and third-party tools to drive productivity gains, operational efficiencies, and enhanced customer satisfaction, ultimately improving Net Revenue Retention. Our key objectives are to maximize the potential of our existing tools, particularly Salesforce and Gainsight, and identify areas where additional solutions can further support our goals.

Current Progress and Initiatives:
We are optimizing the use of tools like MS Copilot, with expanded access across the organization, to enhance productivity and efficiency.
Our Professional Services team is actively working on two projects aimed at driving productivity gains, with an additional nine projects in the scoping phase for future development.

Gong: A pilot of Gong was conducted in Q4-2024, with 20 out of 40 participants actively engaging. As of February 27, 2025, Corporates is moving forward with 633 Gong licenses. Erin Brown provided an update on Monday, February 24. CE is currently working with sourcing to purchase the licenses and are connecting with Sara Donavan of the Corporates Transformation Team on Friday, February 28, 2025 to discuss the rollout plan. 

Future Direction:
Our strategy for 2025 is to continue to fully utilize our current tools and assess potential gaps that may be addressed through additional solutions.
We will prioritize initiatives that drive tangible productivity gains, operational efficiencies, and customer satisfaction improvements, ultimately supporting our Net Revenue Retention goals.

By building on our existing foundation and strategically investing in AI-powered tools and initiatives, we are well-positioned to drive business growth, improve customer satisfaction, and maintain our competitive edge in the market.
Key Risks and Issues:
The successful execution of our Corporate Internal Gen AI strategy is contingent upon centralized team support and end-user adoption enablement. 

Centralized Team Support: It was already called out and acknowledged in a February 4 meeting that more support is needed from centralized teams and product owners to drive AI adoption within the tools they support. To ensure end-users are aware of and proficient in using the Gen AI functionality, we require more active engagement and enablement from these teams. This includes supporting the roll out, providing training, documentation, and change management support to facilitate seamless adoption and optimal utilization of our AI-powered tools.

End-User Adoption and Enablement: The effective use of Gainsight, Salesforce, and Conversica, in particular, relies on end-users being aware of the Gen AI functionality and understanding how to leverage it to drive productivity gains and customer satisfaction improvements. Without sufficient training, support and enablement, we risk underutilization of these critical tools, which may negatively impact our ability to achieve our Net Revenue Retention goals.

Change Management: There is no designated change management support in 2025. As we roll out new AI tools in 2025, it is imperative that change management is prioritized by every group rolling out a solution. They need to acknowledge the current organizational landscape and present the tools as solutions to existing challenges. By doing so, we can ensure a smoother adoption, maximize the benefits of these innovative technologies, and effectively address the needs of our stakeholders.

To drive successful adoption of new tools, we must clearly define ownership, collaborate with Sales Enablement on training and support, and embed a change management mindset across teams to address current challenges and demonstrate the problem-solving value of these tools.
Progress on Use Case this period:
As of 2/27/2025, an additional 105 MS Copilot licenses have been assigned to Corporates users bringing the total Copilot licenses assigned to 705. 

As of February 27, 2025, Corporates is moving forward with 633 Gong licenses. Erin Brown provided an update on Monday, February 24. CE is currently working with sourcing to purchase the licenses and are connecting with Sara Donavan of the Corporates Transformation Team on Friday, February 28, 2025 to discuss the rollout plan.
Details on Change Management: There has not been any new change management efforts since the start of 2025. The need has been raised above and will be the responsibility of all to consider the current state and how the solutions help address the current challenges.
Path Forward:
As we look to 2025, our path forward is focused on building on the foundation established in 2024, with a emphasis on optimizing the adoption of our current tools, expanding the use of AI-powered solutions, and driving business outcomes through targeted use cases. Key priorities include:

Optimizing Current Tools: We will focus on maximizing the potential of our existing tools, particularly Gainsight, enabling Einstein tools in Salesforce (particularly Revenue Intelligence to launch in late Q1), and Copilot to drive productivity gains, operational efficiencies, and customer satisfaction improvements.

Restarting and Expanding Conversica: We will restart and expand our use of Conversica, leveraging its capabilities to enhance our sales and customer engagement efforts and explore expansion across other teams in Corporates. 

Accelerating Professional Services Use Cases: We will prioritize the development of Professional Services use cases, focusing on internal process improvement initiatives that drive tangible business outcomes. 

Guidance from Corporate Leadership: We will seek guidance from Corporate leadership on the support and resources that will be provided to drive our Corporate Internal Gen AI strategy in 2025. This will ensure that our efforts are aligned with organizational priorities and that we have the necessary backing to achieve our objectives.

Gong: Rollout plan for Gong will follow as we move forward with 633 licenses to cover all Account Executives, Account Specialists, Customer Success Managers and their respective managers.
Questions / Assistance Needed from the W: (1) How are we taking a more centralized approach to GenAI tool adoption in 2025? (2) How will we be reporting productivity gains of these tools in order to show progress against productiviy gain targets?

Overall Status: Green - As per plan or better
Executive Summary:
TAP’S Internal AI Program has entered 2025 with strong momentum, with the overall status marked as green. v1 of the AI-Powered Pre-Call Planning released in January, utilizing Copilot in Edge. This solution is for whitespace discovery calls. v2 is in development in partnership with Commercial Excellence and will introduce existing customer data to the solution. Planned pilot in Q1.

Copilot licenses have been extended to sales managers, bringing total deployment up to ~120 users. TAAP continues to see high utilization of Copilot where deployed.

Gong continues to get positive praise from the sales team, with call recording completion of Teams meetings sitting at 54%. This completion rate has remained fairly consistent throughout 2024. We are finding varied usage patterns of the functions within Gong. Some users favor Follow-up Email and Ask Anything, while others see the most benefit from using the Pipeline Intelligence area. All US-based SEs, CEs, and SDRs now have Gong access.

AI Sales Assistant: Commercial Policy has entered testing. Commercial Policy team is integrating TAP-specific policies into the knowledge base. Have experienced technical complications with Copilot Studio deployment and Commercial Policy complexities that are delaying release.
Key Risks and Issues: We are seeing a broad spectrum of maturity when it comes to the use of AI, with some users being rather advanced, some users having limited experience, and everything in between. As such, we're balancing accelerating the daily adoption of fundamental functionality with developing advanced use cases to increase benefit over time.
Progress on Use Case this period: Please see executive summary and individual use cases for detailed updates.
Details on Change Management: Reinvigorating change management through the use of Tour of the Teams, designed to integrate specific AI habits into daily workflow. In addition, using weekly newsletter to put AI Use Cases, functionality, and education front and center for the sales floor.
Path Forward:
Q1 is focused on driving utilization. Maya Williams will resume intense focus on Internal AI after leading the Gainsight MVP implementation in TAAP. Her focus is on driving utilization of various AI tools daily, in the sales workflow. Gong will remain a centerpiece for our sales generating teams, with additional use cases augmenting that functionality.

As such, we'll be conducting a Tour of the Teams, going to each sales manager's team meetings over the next month to discuss specific AI habits using existing tools and functionality, that can be incorporated into the daily workflow of our teams. These consulting / coaching sessions are designed to increase utilization and subsequently the impact of our use cases.

In parallel, we'll continue our collaboration with Aroon Jham (Commercial Excellence) to develop v2 of the 1-Click Call Planning. The team has begun integrating existing customer data into the agentic framework. As that matures, we will also begin integrating product and product marketing content to provide more robust and definitive sources of knowledge for product recommendations and positioning. When existing customer data is available, the team will conduct beta testing with sales.

We only have one UX designer, which may be problematic as we seek to move fast to build the capabilities, while also creating an effective and efficient user experience.

We are keeping an eye on LLM costs, which raise questions about the ROI. Right now, we are confident that costs will continue to decrease and our efficiency will continue to improve.

Deployment is contingent on successful testing - and testing requires time and people. It is challenging to manage the desired amount of testing when we are dealing with wide variation across content types, jurisdictions, and publications. We have willing vendor resources, but limited budget - and right now we are trying to handle as much of the testing in-house as possible.

Invisible: use case closed as team has decided not to continue the POC. Tool has good annotation features, but there are no DIY workflow or task build capabilities and there is no expectation that they would be available anytime soon. Integrating Invisible with Content Console was proving more challenging than simply building the capabilities we need.

Executive Summary: The deployment of the Intelligent Assistant has achieved a 20% agent engagement rate through Spring Tax peak, notably reducing Average Handling Time (AHT) 7.7% y/y in January, with ongoing adoption efforts, enhancements and planned expansions. Salesforce Einstein GPT challenges are being managed with an Adobe hotfix and improvements to boost content relevance.  WhatsApp-based AI self-service tool in LatAm achieved a 33.3% call deflection rate, with expansion to India expected early Q2. The Help and Support content team is completing evaluation Adobe's AI tools, with a decision due by March. The Genesys Salesforce Voice initiative will enhance productivity for 225 agents in Q1, and two high-impact C2C initiatives are in the test and learn phase with goals of automating payment matching processes and predicting customer inquiries. CXD is on track to meet its FY savings plan of $1.6M, with a projected early favorability due to higher attrition without backfill. Employee AI tool adoption is increasing, targeting 50% regular usage by 2025, supported by strategic communication and innovation initiatives.
Key Risks and Issues:
1.	RISK - The rollout of Salesforce Einstein has slowed due to problems with publishing from AEM Guides to Salesforce and content creation capacity constraints.  An Adobe hotfix will deployed in February 202 (2/10/25) and content will push to Salesforce soon after. This delay adds risk to the planned 2025 efficiencies.
a.	Mitigation Strategy: Agents have undergone training to author help and support content and generative AI available through Adobe are being explored to address capacity constraints. 
2.	RISK - Efficiencies estimates: Multiple risks to the accuracy of the 2025 productivity estimates including overlap - where anticipated productivity gains from multiple AI initiatives may overlap, delivery timing, incorrect assumptions, etc.  impacting our overall savings estimates.
Progress on Use Case this period:
•The Intelligent Assistant has been deployed to all Accounting CS, Practice CS, and UltraTax CS agents, with training sessions conducted in November and December. The overall engagement rate is approximately 20%, with 73 agents using the tool on 10% or more of their handled calls or chats. The effort notably reduced Average Handling Time (AHT) 7.7% y/y in January.
The tool has shown effectiveness in enhancing support capabilities. The team is focused on refining and optimizing its features based on user feedback and increasing adoption. Recent enhancements include making the Intelligent Assistant available in the UltraTax CS picklist of resources via the Agent Extension for Chrome and Edge. Upcoming enhancements include the addition of internal articles by the end of March. Roll out is planned for 36 additional agents supporting Cloud Audit Suite in June..  
•Further roll-out of Salesforce Einstein GPT and AI knowledge workflow features is on hold due to challenges syncing help content, creating new support content and categorizing content so results returned to agents are relevant. An Adobe hotfix addressing the synch issue was received on February 10, 2025. The AEM to Salesforce connection hotfix is complete, with ongoing stability testing. Content is being pushed from AEM to Salesforce and monitored. Efforts are underway to clean up article duplication from the hotfix, apply content categorization tagging, and improve the knowledge search function before roll-outs to further groups.
• In January, the call deflection for the WhatsApp-based AI self-service tool was 33.3%, an increase of 7pts Month over month, and 53% of requests were solved without human interaction. Early abandoned contact was 16%, a decrease of 2pp month over month showing a positive trend in customer engagement. The in-product Product Support Assistant in TaxOne and LegalOne has been well received, with  9% of customers who opened cases in Jan accessing the AI tool.
•The  Help and Support content team has paused at the proof of concept stage for a home-grown Gen AI solution while analyzing AI tools becoming available through Adobe's cloud solution at mid-year.  These tools are included as part of our current agreement with Adobe.  Initial analysis suggests that the Adobe functionality will be sufficient and provide AI tools to speed authoring and publishing.  Final decision will be made by early March.   
•We are preparing for the Genesys Salesforce Voice deployment by aligning key dates, coordinating trainings, and finalizing KPIs. This initiative will integrate telephony into Salesforce, enhancing agent productivity with AI-powered insights. We aim to deploy the new feature to 225 customer service agents and reference attorneys in Q1, ensuring minimal impact through thorough training and stakeholder coordination.
•Two high- impact initiatives are underway in C2C.  The UI/Suspense Payment Application Initiative aims to automate the manual process of identifying customers using AI and bots. Currently in the "Test and Learn" phase, this initiative is expected to reduce UI/Suspense cases by 50%, improve accuracy, and decrease human error. This will enhance customer experience through faster processing and higher satisfaction. The model's scalability allows it to handle high transaction volumes and seasonal fluctuations, with plans to expand from 2 regions to all regions. The C2C Customer Queries Initiative aims to analyze and predict customer inquiries using LLM. The project, in the ""Test and Learn"" phase, utilizes the AI CARF model to improve customer support, handling around 20,000 queries monthly. This reduces resolution time from 5 days to 2 in 75% of cases and provides insights into customer behavior. It helps identify root issues, lowering dissatisfaction and churn rates for recurring queries. Overall, it enhances support, shortens resolution times, and delivers actionable insights to improve customer experience.
Details on Change Management:
An initial pathway to  2025 savings target has been identified and confirmed with leadership.  Through January, CXD is on track to achieve FY savings plan of $1.6M with some favorability.  FY projected favorability of $270K is due to higher amount of attrition with no backfill.  Forecast was to not backfill 1 FTE in Jan, actual reduction was 11.  As we refresh our numbers for the March forecast, we will likely reduce the reductions in future months as they have already been achieved in January.  This will result in slightly less FY favorability. 

CXD has adopted the TR Enterprise AI OKR for 2025 and will ensure 50% of CXD employees are using Gen AI tools regularly as part of their daily task.  In January 37.7% of CXD employees used Ai tools regularly + 6pp increase from December.  We expect this number to rise naturally as we deploy additional AI tools across the year.
In support of the 2025 goal and to address feedback from 2024 the AI Skills and Adoption survey CXD AI lead and HRBP are working through a department AI communications plan including AI Champions and persona-based AI learning recommendations for 2025.  CXD AI Atrium page and first monthly newsletter (AI Spark: AI Innovation in CXD) will deploy in March.

A working group has been identified and the team will also begin an initiative to leveraging the AIvolution tool (Ideaspace Hub) as a way to capture and govern AI innovation ideas in March.

Demand for MSFT  365 Copilot licenses remains high as groups find Copilot has proven to be an invaluable tool in our daily operations.  Approximate number of licenses held by CXD expanded from ~180 to ~200 in February. Expansion of license availability is largely targeted at product/project managers and team leads/people managers.
Path Forward:
Continued Development and Deployment of planned AI Initiatives:
•Intelligent Assistant: Continue to monitor impact through Spring Peak for UltraTax, Accounting, and Practice CS teams  Upcoming enhancements include the addition of internal articles by the end of March. Roll out is planned for 36 additional agents supporting Cloud Audit Suite in June..  
•Salesforce Einstein GPT: Address technical challenges with help content relevance and create new support content. 
•WhatsApp-based AI Tool: Report customer feedback and impact of the LegalOne product launch. Continu to monitor call deflection and early abandoned contact rates and expand funcitonality based on user feedback.
• Team is currently investigating the expansion of the WhatsApp-based AI self-service tool for India Big 7 customers, providing a self-service tool to address E-filing, Validation and Reject Codes questions.  Initial feedback from customer conversaitons has been positive.  Goal to deploy early Q2.
• Help and Support Content Team: Decide by early March on pursuing proof of concept functionality versus vendor functionality from Adobe. The proof of concept involves retrieving and updating articles using Gen AI.
•Genesys Salesforce Voice: Implement and deploy to 225 agents in Q1, including customer service representatives and reference attorneys. Focus on configuration and training.
Communication/Governance:
•	Highlight success stories and measurable impacts across CXDT through multiple channels (team meetings, town halls, email comms, etc.)  to inspire continued innovation and AI adoption. Ongoing
•	Implement AIvolution tool (IdeaSpace Hub) to capture and prioritize AI innovation ideas. Q1 2025
•	Analyze and improve  savings projections by comparing estimates and actuals to refine our future estimating.  Ongoing

Executive Summary:
Starting this February, we are capturing the various AI use cases and tools being used by Reuters Commercial teams. There is interest within the organization to trial and test various AI tools and use cases. The primary initiatives are focused on GTM segments (marketing and sales) with 6 key use cases being progressed with external AI tools. We also are seeing increased adoption of OpenArena to automate repetitive tasks.

Success stories for February:
Story Kit for Marketing: A rough video with captions was created in an hour, which would have ideally taken us a few days. We needn't have to outsource to external agency and spend time on briefing them.
OpenArena for Marketing: Finished creating an automated web page meta title, meta description and keyword tool. When anyone in the team is creating a new web page or landing page, they run the content through the saved prompt on Open Arena and it will generate the meta title, description and page keyword for SEO purposes.
Teams Premium for all sales: We enabled Teams Premium for all account managers within Reuters, and organized a training to help them make the most of the tool. 

In order to drive engagement and equip the wider business teams to use AI in their day to day, we are launching Learn & share sessions in March. The idea is to have short, impactful training sessions followed by real-world examples from colleagues.
As of February, Reuters AI adoption stands at 48% vs 44% in Jan. Count of Teams Premium has increased as mentioned above after the addition of all Sales and supporting teams roughly by 150 between Dec and Jan.
Key Risks and Issues:
Budget and prioritization come up in several of these conversations.
On OpenArena, while there are many ideas and use cases we could pursue, we need to find a way to support teams in building these out.
There is also interest in trying premium services from OpenArena like Operator and DeepResearch - how do we get these prioritized for OpenArena roadmap (if relevant).
Progress on Use Case this period:
Story Kit: Trialed, currently onboarding. Key feedback is it has broader set of functionalities that work well for creating videos faster. Marketing has started to onboard it to use it for 1 year and evaluate output / efficiency & cost gains.
Adobe Firefly: We are trialing out of curiosity, as we mostly use Reuters-owned images on our Agency designs (which we can’t manipulate). The feedback is we might not be able to use it in a safe way in Reuters Agency business.
Jasper: We haven't taken it forward due to restricted budgets and prioritization of other tasks
Gong: It is currently on hold and is being reassessed with product and tech teams around already planned systems development (Reuters Salesforce instances integration)
Salesforce - Sales Engagement: Already part of license. Still in ideation phase
Outreach: Ideation
Details on Change Management: NA
Path Forward: Continue to test and learn for Story Kit. For others, we need to try to move forward on the roadblocks
Questions / Assistance Needed from the W: Our marketing team would love to understand more about the tools being trialed by TR Marketing and Print teams (Adobe Firefly and Enterprise Writer). How can we collaborate and do joint trials?

User Acceptance Testing (UAT) is scheduled for the third week of March, engaging Sourcing SMEs from the RFP Optimization program to validate functionality and optimize the solution. The formal go-live has been set for the second week of April 2025, followed by plans to expand RFP Template automation throughout Q2.

Services Gateway Chatbot Development: Following evaluation of the 'TR Ask Julius' chatbot, development will proceed using Copilot Studio to leverage its advanced capabilities and Microsoft's continuous feature enhancements. This strategic decision aims to create a more sophisticated and flexible chatbot solution that aligns with our long-term objectives. The initial MVP, focusing on the Travel & Expenses process, is scheduled for testing by the third week of March, establishing a foundation for future expansion and enhancement of service delivery.
